home.description: I am a Ph.D. in Astrophysics based in Santiago, Chile, with experience spanning academic research, higher-education teaching, and applied research and development. My academic work focuses on the interstellar medium and star formation in distant, gravitationally lensed galaxies at high redshift, using multi-wavelength observations and radio and sub-mm interferometry such as ALMA. In parallel, I have led publicly funded R&D and innovation projects, coordinating interdisciplinary teams and translating scientific methods into validated technological solutions.
home.highlight: Bridging academic research, university teaching, and applied innovation through data-driven and interdisciplinary work.

papers.abstract: My research focuses on the interstellar medium and star formation in distant, gravitationally lensed galaxies. I use multi-wavelength datasets and radio and sub-mm interferometry, primarily ALMA, to constrain gas, dust, and star formation properties and their evolution across cosmic time.
